alert.note: Alert for Bourbon; Harrison (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 09 at 12:42PM EST until January 13 at 10:00PM EST by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of EAST CENTRAL Kentucky, including the following areas, Bourbon, Clark, Harrison, Nicholas and Scott. * WHEN...Until 345 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1241 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated moderate the occasionally heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Georgetown, Winchester, Paris, Cynthiana, Carlisle, Millersburg, North Middletown, Stamping Ground, Sadieville and Currentsville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
